qas.question: What is one example of a limitation on the system?

answers.text: the system is subject to gaming

qas.question: What is generally unable to support variations in the number of people for a particular destination?
For what reason do people repeatedly push the up/down buttons on a panel?

answers.text: people believe this to be an effective way to hurry elevators

qas.question: Why is this a bad practice?

answers.text: this will make the computer think multiple people are waiting and will allocate empty cars to serve this one person

context: However, performance enhancements cannot be generalized as the benefits and limitations of the system are dependent on many factors. One problem is that <a0_0>the system is subject to gaming<a0_0/>. Sometimes, one person enters the destination for a large group of people going to the same floor. <a1_0>The dispatching algorithm<a1_0/> is usually unable to completely cater for the variation, and latecomers may find the elevator they are assigned to is already full. Also, occasionally, one person may press the floor multiple times. This is common with up/down buttons when <a2_0>people believe this to be an effective way to hurry elevators<a2_0/>. However, <a3_0>this will make the computer think multiple people are waiting and will allocate empty cars to serve this one person<a3_0/>.
